website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option with reasonable performance, especially considering the price.
pros: Produces light that's neither too bright nor too dull
Owners say they don't notice a buzz
cons: light doesn't get as dim as some competitors

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs are great! They are absolutely dimmable and make zero noise
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great! They are absolutely dimmable and make zero noise. They are slightly brighter at full power then a conventional 60 watt incandescent bulb. Note: I saw a review of this product stating they were not dimmable with a picture of it printed on the bulb. This is not the case for Philips 461228 60 Watt Equivalent Soft White Dimmable A19 LED Light Bulb that I ordered here on Amazon. Pic attached. They dim just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Terrible dimming.
customer_reviews.text: Mine went down to maybe 70% of max brightness, and that's probably generous. With four in a bedroom it was still Quite bright with the dimming slider all the way down, and this is an expensive dimmer intended for LEDs and CFLs, not a cheap rheostat style. I went out to Lowes and bought four Sylvania dimmable LEDs with the same color temp for $2.75 each, and they dim way down, almost as far as incandescent bulbs go.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A little "cooler" white than regular light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Light bulbs are dimmable. They are quite bright - I think brighter than regular light bulbs, but it could just be that they look a little different. These are a more cooler white than regular incandescent light bulbs. It takes a little getting used to. Also - if you have a dimmable light switch, you may need to replace the light switch. Apparently ordinary dimmable switches still leave a trickle current ~ 1 watt even when off. Too little to illuminate a regular light bulb, but when LEDs use only 7 watts, it's more than enough electricity to illuminate these just a little.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs work great. They're a tad brighter than I expected and I touch whiter (cooler color) than I hoped, but not so much that I don't like them. Contrary to other reviews, these bulbs are indeed dimmable, as I have them in several dimmable fixtures, and they're flicker free all the way to the cutoff. The other reviewers that say they aren't dimmable are either reviewing the wrong item or received the wrong item. However, while they do dim, they don't go nearly as low as an incandescent bulb before going out completely. That's the only down side. Otherwise, great bulbs!
customer_reviews.author: G. Garthe

customer_reviews.title: Lighting is great but bulbs not so much
customer_reviews.text: Lighting is great but bulbs not so much. After two months use, many of the bulbs purchased have cracking or clicking sounds when powered on or off. Whats worse is that the cracking sounds continues on after the power has been cut for about an hour or so after. I assume the sound is related to heat expansion and afterwards the cooling.... These lights are not in any enclosed light fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 8 bulbs didn't work. A 50% ...
customer_reviews.text: 4 out of 8 bulbs didn't work. A 50% failure rate for LED light bulbs is not acceptable. I bout twice as many of the same bulbs from Home Depot today. 100% worked.
customer_reviews.author: Shark

customer_reviews.title: A friend who works in the lighting industry recommended these bulbs
customer_reviews.text: A friend who works in the lighting industry recommended these bulbs, I can't say enough good things about them. They aren't the cheapest ones on the market but the quality is rock solid. I replaced every light bulb (flood and regular sized A19) throughout my entire house inside and out. The color, consistency, and brightness are fantastic! Well worth every penny, and my electric bill is seeing the benefit as well. I don't have to worry about leaving a light on as it barely costs anything with LED bulbs. Plus, LED bulbs last so long I'll likely never have to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Silence, it's Golden.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars, hands down. These bulbs are absolutely silent even when dimmed. I have the Leviton Decora Smart Z-Wave Dimmer. These two products make an exceptional combo. I returned the noisy EcoSmart dimmable bulbs and will be only using Philips LEDs now. Love them! They don't dim as dark as the EcoSmart bulbs did, however. I would like these bulbs to be able to dim darker, as the lowest setting isn't dark enough for the mornings after just waking up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work great with Comcast/Xfinity Centralite plugin lamp dimmer modules
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy with these. I actually only needed two dimmable bulbs and a couple non-dimmable but the 8 pack was much cheaper than purchasing them separate. I had been trying in vain to find bulbs that would work with Comcast/Xfinity Centralite plugin lamp dimmer modules. All the other bulbs I have tried either wouldn't turn off or flash or not really dim much. These bulbs are the perfect match for the dimmer modules. I had wasted more money on other types/brands of bulbs than these 8 cost. Not sure how they will work with other dimmers but if you have the Comcast system these bulbs are the ones for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mavoo's Computing Services

customer_reviews.title: Destination Bulb for Caseta Dimmers
customer_reviews.text: I’m into the dimmers and automation thing. I had Insteon before I moved and bulbs I liked, but switched to Lutron when I moved and those old bulbs started to sing to me. I tried a few brands, first “No buzz” Cree which was so disappointing, then a few others, and then this. The Phillips aren’t totally silent, but I don’t know that any bulb is going to be, incandescent or LED. The point is: they’re quiet enough that I can run 12 in a hard surface bathroom in vanity sconces and can barely hear anything, even when listening for it. And let’s be real here: my wife doesn’t notice at all and doesn’t complain. CASE CLOSED
customer_reviews.author: Tackchevy

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs started failing within warranty. Philips won't honor warranty after months long many emails.
customer_reviews.text: What more can I say. I feel bad for recommending to friends now that they've started failing, and Philips won't honor their own warranty. The warranty is listed both on Amazon and the box as three years, but after making me jump through hoops for over a month (sending photos of the fixture, bulb, serial numbers, etc), they claim the warranty is only a year. Very poor support - so if you buy these, know you're getting a disposable product with zero support.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fully dim, otherwise good to go.
customer_reviews.text: Although dims a bit, as others mentioned, minimum light level is about 40% of max. This is way too bright for, say, bathroom application -- a night time visit to bathroom blinds your eyes. Further, unlike incandescent bulb, temperature doesn't increase as it dims -- so you have this bright and whiter than incandescent light.. It is perfect in every other sense. Doesn't buzz, doesn't overheat; for now, we have not had any one of these go bad. At full illumination, light level is very comfortable and indistinguishable from incandescent light.
customer_reviews.author: Magician

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware: The description says "dimmable" BUT, the can't be used with a dimmer???
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue if this is a good product or not but I ordered them to replace some non-LED bulbs that all operate with dimmers. Since the ad clearly says "dimmable" I assumed that they would most certainly operate via a dimmer switch, as has every other LED light we have purchased. But the back of the package clearly says "do not operate with a dimmer" so I have no choice but to return them. The seller needs to change his ad so that it is clear what they will and will not do.
customer_reviews.author: Shiny Metal Affliction

customer_reviews.title: very bright, nice color (2700K)
customer_reviews.text: very bright, nice color (2700K) rated at 800 lumens/9.5 watts they are far brighter than the "energy efficient' 71 watt Sylvania bulbs that claim to put out 1450 lumens they replaced. One caveat, though is that when these dim they stay the same color. For a dimmable LED bulb that becomes warmer with dimming consider the Phillips warm glow LED bulb, also 9.5 watts 800 lumens at full power, that becomes a warmer 2400K when dimmed. Difficult to find on Amazon, but available at big box retailers for about $4.5 per bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley K

customer_reviews.title: Nice dimmable bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with these bulbs. There is a little lag time when I flip the switch, but not long. They dim down very nicely and are very bright when on full. I replaced the dimmer for one that is compatible with LED bulbs - there really is such a thing and the bulbs don't work without one! I'm thrilled that these stay cool - my dining room table is no longer like sitting under a heat lamp in a chicken coop.
customer_reviews.author: Jagroo

customer_reviews.title: These dim only to 50%!!
customer_reviews.text: These dim to 50% at best, be warned! And that's on a regular magnetic dimmer. Go to an electronic dimmer and they dim even less. If you want a bulb to replace your incandescents that will dim really low down to 5-10% these are not for you and you're better saving your money and going for non-dimmable bulbs. Other than that they give off a nice warm light and work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: ollyh

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to install on our new chandelier. Chandelier ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to install on our new chandelier. Chandelier was previously on an old dimmer with Glolux A19 Dimmable LED Light Bulbs making the lights have a strobe light effect when dimmed so we replaced the dimmer with this Lutron MACL-153M-WH. Then we started hearing buzzing; verified the electrical connections were ok; read some reviews on the Lutron dimmer and found out that not all LED bulbs are compatible. Ended up returning the Glolux A19 Dimmable LED Light Bulb and buying Philips 461228 to replace them. No more buzzing.
customer_reviews.author: Eunicom

customer_reviews.title: Best quality bulb out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is the highest quality dimmable LED bulb I could find. I use them throughout our home. I’m very pleased with the light produced and when used with Lutron CFL/LED Diva Dimmer Switch these bulbs perform flawlessly. No flickering and a good range of brightness. I highly recommend and will buy these bulbs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tintin Norge

customer_reviews.title: NO Buzz and nice dimming range.
customer_reviews.text: previously bought Sylvania 79084 Dimmable LED Bulb,14W A19 because CNET said they were hands down the best LED's out there. I put them in my bathroom. They were hardly dimmable. and they made a HUGE Buzzing noise. sounded like i was in a shop under fluorescent lights. Bought these to replace them and I am SUPER Happy I did. These bulbs dim more than the others and ZERO buzzing or humming. I'll be buying more no doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Trombley

customer_reviews.title: LED Dimmable bulbs work great !
customer_reviews.text: I installed these light bulbs in our church yesterday and they work great ! We already had Philops bulbs but someone did not know you needed to use dimable bulbs. I have read previously some of the reviews thought they dimed to total darkness our dimmer switch will not go to total darkness but down to very low light but not total darkness ! for the ones who want to know ! I got what I wanted in a dimmable bulb ! Money wise it's was a good price and for the life the bulbs are supposed to last 22 years, I doubt know if I will last 22 years ? Good buy !
customer_reviews.author: Douglas L. Rupert Sr.

customer_reviews.title: I bought the Philips 60 watt LED dimmable in the chandler base and they work just fine so I am not sure what is going on
customer_reviews.text: I got this 60 watt dimmable bulbs but they only dim down to about a 40 watt bulb and really needed down to a 20 watt for the range of lighting that I was wanting. In less than a week one of the bulbs has stopped working. I am extremely disappointing in this product!! Note: I bought the Philips 60 watt LED dimmable in the chandler base and they work just fine so I am not sure what is going on.
customer_reviews.author: B. Edward Oakley II

customer_reviews.title: Noisy lightbulbs
customer_reviews.text: These produce a nice light but also a loud buzzing sound, even at full brightness. I’ve ordered an earlier generation of this Philips bulb and there wasn’t an issue with buzzing (at full brightness and dimmed) so not sure why a newer bulb is doing this. Disappointing! I’ll have to find another bulb to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great without replacing fixtures
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these in hopes of replacing mismatched regular incandescent bulbs in ceiling fixtures. I'd heard from acquaintances that the ceiling fixtures would all need to be replaced. No fear, these bulbs work perfectly with the existing fixtures and dimming switch. Can't quite get them to dim below a certain point, say to recreate theater lighting but I'm still fine with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mutineer

customer_reviews.title: Philips is the LED boss. Go with the best
customer_reviews.text: LED bulbs are everywhere these days. They can even be had at the Dollar store for a buck. But don't be fooled. Frequently they are the wrong color temperature (you want 2700 degrees) or they aren't dim-able, or they don't last very long. You can count on Philips to produce a bulb that's dim-able, long lasting, and color correct. Buy a good one and you won't be back up there on that step stool changing it again.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great LED Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to replace your normal 60wat light bulbs with an LED alternative these are the bulbs for you. At 2700K they deliver a near identical soft white glow as what you are used to with your normal 60wat bulb. LEDs at higher K (i.e. 3000K or 5000K) are a much brighter (bluer) light. If you are looking for the soft white glow 2700K is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle_xo1

customer_reviews.title: No humming
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new light fixture and led bulbs that said dimmable from lowes. After installing them the fixture was humming. Turns out the light bulbs were actually not rated that well for dimmable bulbs. I came across these on Amazon and the humming is gone. Will be putting these in all my dimmable fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: FUSIONCHA0S

customer_reviews.title: I am keeping them to use hopefully with better results in lights without dimmers
customer_reviews.text: I looked for dimmable bulbs so I could use them in a lamp with a dimmer switch. They don't work as well as I expected. They go off when set at a very low level and flicker intermittently at even full power. The 60 watt equivalent bulb is very bright though. I am keeping them to use hopefully with better results in lights without dimmers.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel M

customer_reviews.title: In a World Where Incandescents are Contraband...
customer_reviews.text: I've picked up several packs of these over the past few months. Been really happy with them. They do get hot at the base and I've yet to put one in a fully-enclosed space (but I'm planning to.) They work great outside - energy efficiency like a CFL but cold-weather performance of a filament. Same in the garage. I bought the dimmable set because our outdoor lights dim based on motion. Overall, these are a really nice replacement for the incandescent bulbs. Couple perks... they work well in places filaments don't. For example, LED bulb in my bench grinder and on the garage door opener. Both places tend to eat filament bulbs due to vibration.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Bad Buzz. Skip these.
customer_reviews.text: Caused Loud buzzing at all brightness settings with new light fixture and new LED compatible dimmer switch. Went to hardware store and bought Other brand of bulbs that work great. Don’t understand why all LED brand bulbs aren't fully functional.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Feral

customer_reviews.title: Cool soft light, even when dimmed. Mild acceptable buzzing
customer_reviews.text: This older generation of Phillips LED A19 does not have the warmer glow effect. So if you want a cool soft light, even when dimmed, this is the right one. My kitchen lamp are Tiffany style with light colored shades and these bulbs make the shades look even nicer when lit up. I have tried LED with glow effect and incandescent bulbs but their light was just too warm for a cool colored shade. So, turned out sometimes it needs the right bulbs for the right shades. Also this one has mild acceptable buzzing. Phillips LED A21 bulbs have loud buzz.
customer_reviews.author: Anh

customer_reviews.title: Not totally dimmable.
customer_reviews.text: Although the bulbs are "dimmable" as stated in the description and on the package, they only dim somewhat. Other LED bulbs that I have will dim to a faint glow, these only dim to, maybe, 50%. (Yes, the dimmer switch is rated for LED.) For my specific application this time, this is adequate, but if you are looking for an LED that dims to a soft glow, this bulb isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Solid, affordable, dimmable LED bulbs with good color temperature
customer_reviews.text: These light bulbs dim sort of incrementally when near the lowest setting...like different steps of brightness rather than a smooth ramp. This is an observation and something to be aware of rather than a complaint. Great light bulbs that have the perfect color temperature that matches all of the other lights in my house, and are very efficient. Upgrade to these and watch your electricity bill shrink.
customer_reviews.author: N. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Great, in some fixtures
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for my application because about half of the base of the bulb causes a shadow to be cast on the majority of the fixture it was in. Great for illumination my ceiling of my bathroom, bad for seeing anything else. Ended up with another Phillips LED light without the plastic base because they are the only bulbs that I've found to dim reliably without flickering, buzzing and have full range.
customer_reviews.author: MO

customer_reviews.title: Philips delivers on quality LEDS
customer_reviews.text: Every time I pay the extra for Philips bulbs I'm never disappointed--the quality of the colors are uniform, every bulb works, it never flickers when dimmed. The nuance that their quality offer seem imperceptible--but the experience of entering a room with my philips bulbs is always lovely. I prefer 2700 kelvin bulbs--ambiance!
customer_reviews.author: AnaA

customer_reviews.title: Good, totally would buy again
customer_reviews.text: These work really well with my Legrand dimmer switch, whereas the cheap store-brand dimmable LED bulbs from Lowe's had a terrible humming noise. These don't hum at all; there's only a very slight amount of noise while you're actually moving the dimmer switch, but that even happens with some incandescent bulbs and is nowhere near annoying with these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: jvilla93

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: 6 out of the 8 didnt hum.... 2 did so loud it's like electrical Soviet union humming way past obnoxious when dimmed. Not worth the return game and no local stores have this model. Stuck and hoping the soviet union level quality wears out into a better product.
customer_reviews.author: JOE ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

customer_reviews.title: These are 3 way bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: These are actually 3 way bulbs. They may be dimmable. I haven’t checked that yet. However, when you turn them off and back on they will come on but less bright than the time before. Frustrating that you have to deal with that.
customer_reviews.author: Glen H

customer_reviews.title: Anyone else have them burn out early?
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for a little over a year and a half and would give them 5 stars but one of the 5 has already burnt out. Even if I were using them 24 hours a day they should last longer than that! I'll see how the rest work out.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Bad flickering
customer_reviews.text: Lights flicker intermittently even at full power. I can live with them not dimming all the way down, but the flickering is terrible. No other lights have ever done this, including other Led's. Its only these bulbs, and it happens in multiple fixtures. Guess I got a bad batch. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: S.MO

customer_reviews.title: good quality light
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money. I bought around 40 of these and 15 dimmable ones. The light frequency is exactly like a 60 W incandescent bulb and they fit anywhere those bulbs fit. I brought our whole house down from a max consumption of 3500+ watts for light alone, to no more than 610W max.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect match for 60w incandescent, but not all bulbs are perfect
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived and I set out to replace 6 dimmable lights. It was a perfect replacement, but within 5 minutes one of the new bulbs died. Luckily I ordered an 8 pack so I was able to replace it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I have been extremely happy with the value of these Philips LED's
customer_reviews.text: Now that the prices and color correction of LED's have improved, Its hard not to switch over. I have been extremely happy with the value of these Philips LED's. The color is pleasing and the brightness is closely comparable to a 60 W incandescent. I will continue to replace my old lights as they expire and reap the benefits of the lower operating cost and longevity. A+
customer_reviews.author: BFL

customer_reviews.title: So far, poor quality control.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this order. The first bulb worked fine. The second, tried in two different sockets, was intermittent and then stopped working at all. I have not yet needed any others but on the basis of the present evidence I would say Phillips quality control is not very good. When I use other bulbs I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: SLK

customer_reviews.title: this is not really dimmable, I bought 6 Philips ...
customer_reviews.text: this is not really dimmable, I bought 6 Philips LED A19 60 Watt dimmable light bulb before and they work perfectly. But these are totally another story, even the brightness is not match with my old ones. Return them
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Phillips I Am Disappiinted
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. One bulb is missing. I had to return the entire package instead of the bulb being replaced. How is it possible one bulb is missing. A human would not have missed this. I don't understand. Geez. As far as the product, works well even though it seems 60watts would be brighter. Breeding refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Verrie G

customer_reviews.title: Philips wins. My new go-to replacement bulb.
customer_reviews.text: These are now my favorite replacement bulbs. I've tried a bunch over the last few years, and these are checking all the boxes... Nearly identical light quality to incandescent, perfect dimming without flicker and no buzzing, even in my most difficult fixtures and old-school switches. These are going on my subscription list!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Top LED A19 Bulb
customer_reviews.text: You can't get better than Philips - great color - no flicker - bright - good 2700K color. Long lasting and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: the best replacement bulb
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my CFLs'. much better light and instant brightness. shouldn't need to change these in my lifetime. I also used them in the dimmable church chandelier. They can't be dimmed as much as the incandescents but are very adequate for the job
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Bright and long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: These are warm white lights that have a bright output and last a long, long time. We use them in a dimmable fixture in our bathroom for the past year. We liked them so much we ordered more for the rest of the home!
customer_reviews.author: Weekly Whiskers

customer_reviews.title: ... did not operate from the get go I was terribly
customer_reviews.text: One of my lights was a dud did not operate from the get go I was terribly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Adam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Use the right dimmer!
customer_reviews.text: These produce excellent light for the kitchen, bathrooms, and living room. Just make sure you are using a compatible dimmer. I would estimate that I am able to dim these to about 10-15% using a Lutron LED/Incandescent/Florescent slide dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Hush Joe13

customer_reviews.title: Dimmer works!
customer_reviews.text: These worked exactly as needed in my ceiling fan that has a dimmer switch!! So excited as new lightbulbs are so bright these days and could use a little less brightness.
customer_reviews.author: C. Major

customer_reviews.title: Good bulbs - color similar to traditional bulbs
customer_reviews.text: These are good. The color is similar to a traditional incandescent bulb and they dim well with our switches. They are noticeably brighter so it's good they work well with a rheostat switch so we can dim them from the brightest setting.
customer_reviews.author: KC_Amazon_Fan

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE NOT DIMMABLE
customer_reviews.text: These are described as 60 Watt Equivalent Soft White Dimmable A19 LED Light Bulb, BUT THEY DO NOT DIM! It says it clearly on box, which I noticed after inserting them into the lamp.
customer_reviews.author: L. David

customer_reviews.title: Phillips Versus GE (LED Dimmable) Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased GE's dimmable LED bulbs from a local store before buying PHILLIPS' dimmable bulbs from Amazon. The GE bulbs were 50% more expensive and they dimmed about 20%. This was not good enough. The Phillips bulbs dim about 80%. At least for us, this was important. Pricewise, the Phillips bulbs were quite a bit cheaper and offered the same warranty and life. Phillips won hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Ashok M Thakkar

customer_reviews.title: Great value, at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent bargain for these bulbs. They are indeed dimable and work just as well as the dimable single bulbs from HD that cost 10 bucks for one. Will by again.
customer_reviews.author: Monster_Review

customer_reviews.title: Did not receive dimmable as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I paid double for dimmable bulbs and received non-dimmable. I bought these to use with dimmers; just had a chance to install the dimmers. Bulbs are flickering badly so I read the fine print on them and the bulbs say "Do not use with Dimmer". It's past the return time frame.
customer_reviews.author: Golly Miss Molly

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: These work well occasionally. Most of the time they are approx. 30% light output. What gets me most that they all work that way with the exception of one bulb which glows properly always. The other eleven don't usually glow properly. I'm going to buy bulbs from some other manufacturer and throw these out.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck.Kutz-Marks

customer_reviews.title: Warm/yellow light
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs do dim but not very low. The description soft white is in my opinion is misleading as these bulbs are very Warm (yellow). They are bright.
customer_reviews.author: Slowdivr

customer_reviews.title: Nice and bright but they don't dim as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice and bright but they don't dim as well as I expected based off of other LED bulbs I have. These only dim about half way down, possibly its my dimmer but I have the same dimmer on other LED bulbs and those dim down a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: C. Henn

customer_reviews.title: As advertized
customer_reviews.text: They came in original packaging and worked great out of the box . They do dim just fine. Note the dimmer switch used makes a big difference . Cheap slider switch actually worked better than the high dollar one from lowest.Your mileage may vary. Just got them so no idea on lifespan yet.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great for single bulb installs.
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs are bright and dimmable but as far as uniform shape, not in the least. Some were round, some semi oblong, but had a six bulb hanging light with clear bulbs, and the bulbs were different shapes.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Don't last the Advertised time
customer_reviews.text: Thought these bulbs would work well being from Phillips. Description information says can expect up to 25,000 hours which would be a good 20 years at 3 hours a day of use. Bulbs are in our bedroom light and are already failing after 2 years with use of less than an hour daily.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Strebel

customer_reviews.title: Loud startling clicking noise when turned off
customer_reviews.text: All of the 8 bulbs in the package started clicking very loudly a few minutes after being switched off. It's a startling sharp metallic clicking noise that comes unexpectedly 5-10 minutes after the lights are turned off and repeats one or two times a few minutes apart. We keep these in the bedroom in the night table lights, and this noise makes it impossible to fall asleep.
customer_reviews.author: serko92

customer_reviews.title: Warm light with dimmability (using normal dimmer)
customer_reviews.text: Amazon shipped the item with a lightening speed. The package arrives as 4 of dual-bulb boxes. The light is warm and it is indeed dimmable (with normal dimmer with on/off switch). The bulbs feels solid and time would tell how durable they are.
customer_reviews.author: GO FOR IT

customer_reviews.title: Not fully dimable, decent but not great.
customer_reviews.text: They dim only half way, not all the way down to off. Think of it this way it can go from 100% to 50% and anything it between, but after that it goes to 25% and off only, so you cannot have it on at say 10%.
customer_reviews.author: Albert T.

customer_reviews.title: LED lights save money
customer_reviews.text: They’re LED lights. All of them came pre packaged easily opened.
customer_reviews.author: TXGRL

customer_reviews.title: Work ok
customer_reviews.text: Use with a dimmer switch to lower or brighten our lights.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs are much heavier than regular and other led bulbs that I have purchased. Would have returned if it didn't cost so much to ship back. Otherwise bulbs were ok but I deducted a start because of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Actually dim pretty well with the incandescent dimmers ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Actually dim pretty well with the incandescent dimmers that our house came with. Though they do only go down to maybe 50c/o at the lowest setting and the dimmer needs to be set higher when the bulb's switched on, otherwise they don't light. Fact is, these aren't LED dimmers so the performance is quite good. They are warm to the touch at full brightness, but not at all when dimmed. Soft white light is good; very similar to incandescent. Looking forward to many trouble-free years of use and lower electric bills.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Neidecker

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking and buy these!
customer_reviews.text: For many folks, light bulbs have gone from being a simple item purchased in the local hardware store - to an almost endless confusing array of LEDs, Compact Flourescents, and gosh knows what. These bulbs are the closest thing to good old fashioned light bulbs the way they used to be, but they actually have a cleaner light, a great warm color (in 2700K) and instantly made our rooms feel brighter and fresher.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I reordered a 2nd set and just ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I reordered a 2nd set and just about replaced every CFL bulb in my home with these. the quality of light is exceptional. Make sure you go to the Philips website and extend the warranty to 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Doug P

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: I switched my CFL bulbs to these LEDs. The light over my dining table requires 6 dimmable bulbs. These light up right away, with no flickering like I experienced with my CFLs. They are plastic, so no worries about dropping and breaking thin glass bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Diana W.

customer_reviews.title: Dimable, but not very dim
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, and works in my electronic fixtures that have a dimming feature. Would have liked them to go a little more dim but at least they work. It was easier to change the type of bulb then the controller so it works.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Does not honor warranty 10 year! First light broke in 3 months.Stay away
customer_reviews.text: One of the lights already broke in 3 months. Also the so called 10 year warranty? Registering these lights on the website does not work. Contacting Philips by phone or email does not work. I emailed and called but got no response from both. Very bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bulbs a while back, and switched all the lights in my house. So far, they are all still burning bright. I even put one in my refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several boxes of these lights and they are long lasting. Put off just the right amount of light and you can't beat this product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cridertown

customer_reviews.title: Good value, and the soft light in our living ...
customer_reviews.text: Good value, and the soft light in our living room ceiling fan fixture looks better than the clear glass glare that came with it. Looking forward to the LED longevity and energy savings.
customer_reviews.author: dht923nh

customer_reviews.title: much better than the ones I bought at IKEA because these ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping; much better than the ones I bought at IKEA because these Philips LED bulbs don't buzz. Very satisfied with Philips.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Color, and Great
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Bought a bunch to replace all the cheap CFLs in my apartment. The color is a nice and warm temperature, goes great in bedrooms/living rooms. After a couple months of using these, I have nothing bad to say or suggest for improvements. Buy these.
customer_reviews.author: B Frasier

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I like philips bulbs. These are well made and give off a nice light.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyThings

customer_reviews.title: Great product, finally LED's that I can be OK with buying
customer_reviews.text: Converted whole house to LED with these and others. Haven't had an issue with a single one. Will update when a light bulb goes out or malfunctions but I have seen significant declines in power bill because of these.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Muhlestein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These LEDs work great on dimmers, don't buzz or flicker.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great light dispersion and the color of the light is perfect. Installed easily and I have no dimmer issues in any of installs. Definetly worth while and a great buy
customer_reviews.author: R. Pro

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for incandescent lighting.
customer_reviews.text: We are converting the lights in my house to LEDs and these were available at a very good price. I'm very pleased with the light they produce.
customer_reviews.author: Houckster

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Good value LED light for around the house. The color is nice and warm like a regular light and the light distribution is even on all sides.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Love the day light.
customer_reviews.text: Its been a month of usage. Love the bulbs, need to get more. Such a difference between the 5k day light bulbs and bulbs below. Eyes feels much more relaxed.
customer_reviews.author: Kasper

customer_reviews.title: The price was great and worked great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go with my new Lutron Maestro digital dimmer switch. It worked with all bulb types but we had non dimmable CFLs... so I figured I would try dimmable LED instead of going back to incandescent. The price was great and worked great!
customer_reviews.author: A. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT Hue compatible lights
customer_reviews.text: Nice that they are all energy efficient, and look like an old fashioned light bulb rather than the curly que lights...but they are not compatible with HUE system.
customer_reviews.author: J K

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Will not dim to low levels...gets to about 70% dim and then just turns off completely.
customer_reviews.author: MakeWinesNotWar

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for incandescents
customer_reviews.text: These are great bulbs. I replaced 80% of the bulbs in my house and love these.They emit a nice warm glow and plenty of luminance. Cannot tell these from a regular 60W incandescent other than the fact they are very energy efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Prodigal Knot

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive with the right soft white color and dimmable. ...
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive with the right soft white color and dimmable. They make a slight whining noise even at full brightness. Had to put them somewhere other than the dining room light where we could all hear them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Relatively happy with transaction.
customer_reviews.text: So far one build life only 2 months. The rest seem to be working fine.
customer_reviews.author: JGM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes me wish I had never replaced by edison base lights with fluorescents, thanks California Energy Code.
customer_reviews.author: mkennedy2000

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: They work great with the new dimmer switch and light fixture that I installed in the dining room area.
customer_reviews.author: susieHischild

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great Product at a very nice price. Soft white is really a soft white. I use them with a dimmer and they work great
customer_reviews.author: Ralphos

customer_reviews.title: Yes they are dimmable but only about 1/2 the dimmabllity ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes they are dimmable but only about 1/2 the dimmabllity of an incandescent bulb meaning they don't get as dim as an incandescent. It may have something to do with the wall switch but I have two different types rendering the same results.
customer_reviews.author: drfstuff

customer_reviews.title: One Out Eight Already Blowl in less than 3 months of occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: Already blown one bulb when the are guaranteed for 10 years. But too much work involved in getting a replacement bulb.
customer_reviews.author: NotBillGates

customer_reviews.title: Nice lights
customer_reviews.text: Good color good price does the job. Dimmable fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: BB3

customer_reviews.title: Unadvertised further benefit
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, they live up to all expectations. installed in 2 bedrooms, kids live tgat st lowest dim setting the bulbs look like the moon
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Sweeney

product_meta.title: Philips LED Dimmable A19 Frosted Light Bulb: 800-Lumen, 2700-Kelvin, 9.5-Watt (60-Watt Equivalent), E26 Medium Screw Base, Soft White, 8-Pack (Old Generation)
product_meta.description: Size:8 PackPhilips A19 LED light bulbs provide 800 lumens of soft white, dimmable light, equivalent to 60-watt incandescents with 60% less energy use. These bulbs fit standard medium base (E26) fixtures with the look and feel of a classic bulb. Not for use with Philips HUE products. These dimmable LEDs offer flicker-free, silent dimming that works with more dimmer switches than any other LED on the market. The soft white 2700-Kelvin light dims steadily to a comfortable glow just like traditional incandescent light bulbs. Best-in-class Philips LEDs provide turn on instantly with energy-efficient flicker-free, natural light at 1/4 of the energy of incandescents, 1/2 the energy of halogens and with 10X and 4X the lifespan respectively. Philips LEDs are mercury-free so they don't contribute to harmful hazardous waste. Classic A19 soft white light bulbs are perfect anywhere you need a balance of clarity and warmth with the flexibility of dimming. The E26 medium base fits standard fixtures on pendant, vanity, and bare lamps, providing soft white light with warm dimming. This pack of 8 dimmable A19 Philips LEDs comes with a 10-year warranty. Each bulb is expected to deliver a lifetime of up to 25,000 hours, saving you the cost and hassle of frequent bulb replacement.
feature_bullets: ENERGY EFFICIENT: Philips LED Dimmable A19 Frosted Light Bulbs uses 80% less energy than 60 Watt Incandescent Bulbs while maintaining the look and feel of a classic light bulb. Philips LED light bulbs are Mercury free and Energy Star Certified.

LONG LASTING: These Philips LED bulbs last 10x longer than incandescent bulbs. Each light bulb is expected to deliver a lifetime of up to 10,950 hours and 10 years of light (based on three hours per day), saving you the cost of frequent bulb replacement.

SOFT WHITE: Philips LED Dimmable A19 light bulbs offer warm and comfortable lighting with high CRI (color rendering index). At 2700 Kelvin the bulbs deliver bright, crisp color ideal for whole room ambient light as well as in area lamps.

SMOOTH DIMMING: Philips dimmable bulbs are flicker-free, silent, and tested to work with more dimmer switches than any other bulb on the market. These A19 light bulbs smoothly dim from 2700-Kelvin down to a soft glow.
COMPATIBILITY: These Philips LED light bulbs fit in E26 medium screw bases. Not compatible with Philips HUE products. Philips LED Dimmable A19 Light Bulbs are for non connected use only.

COMFORTABLE LIGHT: Our products meet strict test criteria including flicker, strobe, glare and color rendition to ensure they meet EyeComfort requirements. Switch to Philips LED, light that’s designed for the comfort of your eyes.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars435 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
